comment.body:
Stereotype Field is used to map attributes of persistent objects to a relational database. Due to that the stereotype can only be applied on classes with stereotype PersistentObject. Persistence frameworks will map attributes to the database using so called property mapping. This means that for every attribute there will be a row on the database. The mapping between Java and SQL type will be done automatically by default. Using tagged value sqlType it is also possible to define a custom mapping.
Attributes of persistent classes which do not have stereotype Field are considered to be transient.
